title: How to Set Google Chrome As Your Default Browser

steps.title: Open the Start menu and click Settings.
steps.content: Open the Start menu and click Settings . This may just look like a gear icon. Alternatively, press Win + I . If you don't already have Google Chrome installed, download it now from the Google website .

steps.title: Click Apps.
steps.content: Click Apps . This is in the left panel.

steps.title: Click Default apps.
steps.content: Click Default apps . This is the third option in the menu.

steps.title: Click Google Chrome.
steps.content: Click Google Chrome . You can find this in the list of apps. To find it quickly, type "google chrome" into the Search apps field.

steps.title: Click Set default.
steps.content: Click Set default . This button is at the top of the page, next to Make Google Chrome your default browser . Once it's set as default, you'll see a checkmark next to the button.

steps.title: Open the Start menu and click Settings.
steps.content: Open the Start menu and click Settings . This may just look like a gear icon. [1] X Research source Alternatively, press Win + I . If you don't already have Google Chrome installed, download it now from the Google website .

steps.title: Click System.
steps.content: Click System . This is in the settings menu. On some devices, you may need to click Apps instead.

steps.title: Click Default apps.
steps.content: Click Default apps . This is in the left panel. You should see your current default app settings.

steps.title: Click the button under "Web browser".
steps.content: Click the button under "Web browser". If you have another browser set as your default, you'll see its name and icon here. Otherwise, you'll see Choose a default . A pop-up menu will open.

steps.title: Click Google Chrome.
steps.content: Click Google Chrome . This will be in the list of options. If you don't see Google Chrome as an option, make sure it's installed correctly. Google Chrome is now set as your default browser.

steps.title: Click the Apple menu and click System Settings.
steps.content: Click the Apple menu and click System Settings . On older devices, this will look like System Preferences . [2] X Research source If you don't already have Google Chrome installed, download it now from the Google website . Make sure to drag Google Chrome into the Applications folder to install it properly.

steps.title: Click Desktop & Dock.
steps.content: Click Desktop & Dock . On older devices, you'll need to select General instead.

steps.title: Click the "Default web browser" menu.
steps.content: Click the "Default web browser" menu. More options will open.

steps.title: Select Google Chrome.
steps.content: Select Google Chrome . You should see a checkmark next to it. Google Chrome is now your default browser on Mac.

steps.title: Open the Settings app.
steps.content: Open the Settings app. You'll find this on one of your Home screens or in your App Drawer. You can open the App Drawer by tapping the grid button at the bottom of your Home screen. If you don't already have Google Chrome, you can download it from the Google Play Store .

steps.title: Select Apps.
steps.content: Select Apps . This will display all of the apps installed on your Android device.

steps.title: Tap Default apps.
steps.content: Tap Default apps . You should see this option at the top of the screen, under General . [3] X Research source On some devices, you may see Choose default apps instead.

steps.title: Tap Browser app.
steps.content: Tap Browser app . You'll see this at the top of the list and it displays your current default web browsing app. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Chrome.
steps.content: Tap Chrome . You should see a checkmark next to it. Chrome is now set as your default browser. You can close Settings or tap the arrow button to navigate back. All links you open will open by default in Chrome! [5] X Research source

steps.title: Open the Settings app.
steps.content: Open the Settings app. Tap the app with the gray gear on it. [6] X Research source If you don't already have Google Chrome, you can download it from the App Store .

steps.title: Tap Apps.
steps.content: Tap Apps . If you have an older iOS version, skip this step.

steps.title: Tap Chrome.
steps.content: Tap Chrome . This is in your list of apps. You may need to scroll down to find it.

steps.title: Tap Default Browser App.
steps.content: Tap Default Browser App . This will allow you to choose your default web browser.

steps.title: Tap Chrome from the menu.
steps.content: Tap Chrome from the menu. Once you do, a checkmark will appear next to the menu item. This will change your default browser to Google Chrome so any links you open (like from an email) will open in Chrome!

steps.title: Install Chrome.
steps.content: Install Chrome. Chrome will need to be installed before you can set it as your default browser. You can download Chrome by visiting google.com/chrome/ in Internet Explorer. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Open the Control Panel.
steps.content: Open the Control Panel. You can find this in your Start menu. In Windows 8, right-click the Start button and select Control Panel , or type "control panel" on the Start screen.

steps.title: Select Default Programs.
steps.content: Select Default Programs . If you're in Category view, click the "Programs" category first. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Click Set your default programs.
steps.content: Click Set your default programs . It may take a while for the list of programs to load.

steps.title: Select "Google Chrome" from the list of programs.
steps.content: Select "Google Chrome" from the list of programs. You may have to scroll to find it.

steps.title: Click Set this program as default.
steps.content: Click Set this program as default . This will assign Chrome to be the default program for all web links and HTML files.
